titleStmt.title: Commonwealth of Kentucky v. Walter McChesney, J. O. Hunter, Charles Hooper, & Benjamin T. Gray, Indictment
CWG6496

availability.p: This image and transcription is publicly accessible. The image appears courtesy of the repository named in the Source Description. The transcription and annotation were undertaken by Kentucky Historical Society staff, volunteers, and interns. If referencing this document title, accession number, and permanent URL.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition
Early Access

msIdentifier.repository: Kentucky Department for Libraries and Archives
msIdentifier.collection: Office of the Governor, Thomas E. Bramlette: Governor's official correspondence file, petitions for pardons, remissions, and respites 1863-1867

body.p:
Caldwell. Circuit. Court.
The Commonwealth of Kentucky
Against } Indictment for Robery,
Walter. McChesney, J O Hunter. Charles Hooper & Benjamin T. Gray.

The Grand Jury of Caldwell County, in the name and by the authority of the Commonwealth of Kentucky accuse Walter McChesney J O Hunter. Charles Hooper and Benjamin T Gray of the crime of Robery committed as follows. viz The said Walter McChesney J O Hunter Charles Hooper, and Benjamin T Gray on the 30th day of October 1862, in the County aforesaid feloniously took dry goods. wares and merchandize the property of Wm Cash from the possession and in the presence of said Wm Cash and against his will by putting him in fear of some immediate injury to his person against the peace and dignity of the Commonwealth of Kentucky.

Information given by
Wm cash
J R Farlip
John Weatley
L S Thomson Foreman
Grand Jury. D W McGoodwin
attorney for the Commonwealth protem

A Copy
atteste E. P. Watkins Clk c c c
By F. W. Dabney, D. C.
Bench warrant to Issue & bail of defts fixed at $300. each

A copy.
attest F. W. Dabney D C.

Commonwealth
vs. } Indictment for Robery
Walter McChesney J O= Hunter. Charles Hooper & Benj T Gray,
A True Bill
L S Thomson
Foreman of the Grand Jury.
Filed & noted in open Court
Decr 3d 1862.
att J C Barnes D C
Issd
A copy
fee 50,c
